title: Run SaTScan Analysis — satscanr
text: SaTScan (short): SaTScan detects evaluates clusters scanning many candidate windows across space, time, space-time. candidate window, computes probability-model-specific likelihood ratio (analogous test statistic) comparing risk inside window versus outside. window maximum statistic reported likely cluster. Statistical significance typically assessed Monte Carlo simulation null, repeating scan obtain null distribution maximum statistic. Probability models: likelihood/test statistic depends ModelType (e.g., discrete Poisson, Bernoulli, space-time permutation, multinomial, ordinal, exponential, normal). function delegates inferential details SaTScan executable; documentation summarizes general workflow. Example (discrete Poisson; high-rate scanning): Let \(C\) total cases, \(c\) observed cases inside window, \(E\) expected cases inside window null (possibly covariate-adjusted). commonly reported likelihood ratio form proportional : $$ \Lambda = \left(\frac{c}{E}\right)^{c} \left(\frac{C-c}{C-E}\right)^{C-c} \cdot \mathbb{}(c > E) $$ \(\mathbb{}(c > E)\) enforces "high-rate" constraint. (low-rate two-sided scanning, indicator rule differs; see SaTScan User Guide.) Example (Bernoulli; high-rate scanning): Let \(C\) total cases, \(c\) cases inside window, \(N\) total observations (cases + controls), \(n\) observations inside window. SaTScan uses analogous likelihood ratio based -window vs --window case proportions. User guide: full details model-specific likelihoods, scanning windows, parameter definitions, see SaTScan technical documentation (includes User Guide PDF): https://www.satscan.org/techdoc.html
